snippet: The series of explosions, which caused property damage but no casualties, sharpened mistrust between Fatah and its longtime rival, Hamas. No group has taken responsibility for the blasts.
abstract: Series of small explosions at homes and headquarters of several Fatah leaders in Gaza cause little damage and no casualties but heightens tensions with longtime rival Hamas; timing of anonymous attacks, days before 10th anniversary of death of Yasir Arafat, leave many people skeptical about Hamas's denial.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and MAJD AL WAHEIDI
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Majd Al Waheidi from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: The series of explosions, which caused property damage but no casualties, sharpened mistrust between Fatah and its longtime rival, Hamas. No group has taken responsibility for the blasts.

headline.main: Attacks on Fatah Sites Sharpen Tensions in Gaza
headline.print_headline: Attacks on Fatah Sites Sharpen Tensions in Gaza
